articles.title: About
articles.contents:
I lecture in physics at the Technological University Dublin and I’m a part of ML-Labs. Research-wise, I work in data science, mostly astrophysics or neuroscience. My original background was in materials science, making new inter-metallic compounds based on uranium and looking at their structural and physical properties at temperatures down to 2.2K. I then spent some time as a medical physicist, developing teleradiology systems. But then discovered R programming about 2015 and haven’t looked back since.
This blog is an eclectic mix of posts featuring stuff I find interesting. I’ve have a fondness for maps, and specifically coordinate transformations, and especially maps of my home turf of Donegal. Over the years, I’ve spent a lot of time on golf courses, volleyball courts, and tennis courts, so they feature here too. I’m involved in politics. And of course there will be plenty of physics, and not just the astrophysics / neuroscience / bioinformatics stuff.



Loading my github calendar data.



You can find me at …


eugene100hickey

eugene100hickey

eugene.hickey@tudublin.ie

Department of Applied ScienceTechnological University Dublin,TallaghtD24FKT9Ireland



You can also find me at various conferences and events. I’m a regular at the NHSr Community Conferences, involved with WhyR! and various meetups in Dublin (or other chapters sometimes). And I’m now using Mastodon quite a bit, rather than the other thing.

articles.title: Resources
articles.description: This section contains some resources that are perhaps useful for others.
articles.contents:
Resources
Genomics
The laboratory of Rafael Irizarry 
Book by Avril Coghlan 
Book by Cristianini and Hahn 
Bioconductor conferences 
Maps Stuff
R and GIS 
Book by Lovelace and Nowosad 
Course from Antonio Paez 
Copernicus (Sentinel etc) satellite data 
Learning R
Dublin R Meetup  
R for data science community  
Tidy Tuesday
Big Book of R 
Data Visualisation
Excellent course from Cédric Scherer 
Book by Claus Wilkie 
Book by Kieran Healy 
Cheatsheet from Zev Ross 
Blogs I like
Shannon Pileggi at Piping Hot Data 
Shirin Elsinghorst on all things R 
Garrick Aden-Buie, he of xaringanExtra etc 
Will Chase and the Glamour of Graphics 
And Maëlle Salmon for R coding 
And Emi Tanaka who largely inspired the layout of these pages 
And Silvia Canelon for some great examples of using xaringan

articles.title: Selected Talk listing
articles.description: This section contains the list of my talks and workshops where made available. Not all talks are listed here.
This section contains the list of my workshops and teaching.
articles.contents:
I currently teach on the following courses
Data Visualisation with ggplot2 to Postgraduate Students (100%)
Manufacturing Technology to 4th Year Pharmaceutical Science (50%)
Computer Measurement Systems to 2nd Year Bioanalysis (33%)
Principles of Physics to 1st Year Sports Science (100%)
